intro: Platycoryne guingangae, commonly known as the Guingang orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and striking coloration. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are broad and strap-shaped, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences with a distinct scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
